009
010package imagingbook.common.image;
011
012import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
013
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.sRgb65ColorSpace;
017
018/**
019 * This class defines a "color stack" as a subtype of {@link PixelPack}
020 * with exactly 3 components (slices), representing a color image
021 * in a specific color space (default is {@link sRgb65ColorSpace}).
022 * It allows simple conversion to other color 
023 * spaces (see {@link #convertFromSrgbTo(ColorSpace)}).
024 * All conversions are 'destructive', i.e., the affected color stack
025 * is modified.
026 * Pixel values are typically in [0,1], depending on the associated
027 * color space.
028 * A {@link ColorStack} may be created from an existing
029 * {@link ColorProcessor} whose pixels are assumed to be in sRGB
030 * color space (see {@link #ColorStack(ColorProcessor)}).
031 * To be converted back to a {@link ColorProcessor}, the {@link ColorStack}
032 * must be in sRGB color space (see {@link #convertToSrgb()}).
033 * 
034 * @author WB
035 * @version 2022/09/10
036 */
037public class ColorStack extends PixelPack {
038        
039        // the current color space of this color stack
040        private ColorSpace colorspace = null;
041        
042        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
043        
044        /**
045         * Constructor.
046         * @param cp a color image assumed to be in sRGB
047         */
048        public ColorStack(ColorProcessor cp) {
049                super(cp, 1.0/255, null);
050                setColorSpace(sRgb65ColorSpace.getInstance());
051        }
052        
053        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
054        
055        /**
056         * Returns the 3 color components as an array of {@link FloatProcessor}.
057         * @return a {@link FloatProcessor} array
058         */
059        public FloatProcessor[] getProcessors() {
060                FloatProcessor[] processors = new FloatProcessor[3];
061                for (int k = 0; k < 3; k++) {
062                        processors[k] = new FloatProcessor(width, height, data[k]);
063                }
064                return processors;
065        }
066        
067        /**
068         * Returns the current color space instance of this {@link ColorStack}.
069         * @return the current color space
070         */
071        public ColorSpace getColorspace() {
072                return this.colorspace;
073        }
074        
075        private void setColorSpace(ColorSpace colorspace) {
076                this.colorspace = colorspace;
077        }
078        
079        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
080        
081        /**
082         * Converts the pixel values of this {@link ColorStack} to the specified
083         * color space. The color stack must be in sRGB space.
084         * Exceptions are thrown if the color stack is not in sRGB color space
085         * or the target color space is sRGB.
086         * 
087         * @param targetColorspace the new color space
088         */
089        public void convertFromSrgbTo(final ColorSpace targetColorspace) {
090                if (!(colorspace instanceof sRgb65ColorSpace)) {
091                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack must be in sRGB");
092                }
093                
094                if (targetColorspace instanceof sRgb65ColorSpace) {
095                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert color stack from sRGB to sRGB");
096                }
097                
098                final float[] srgb = new float[3];
099                
100                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
101                        getPix(i, srgb);
102                        clipTo01(srgb);
103                        float[] c = targetColorspace.fromRGB(srgb);
104                        setPix(i, c);
105                }
106                
107                setColorSpace(targetColorspace);
108        }
109        
110        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
111
112        /**
113         * Converts this {@link ColorStack} to sRGB space.
114         * An exceptions is thrown if the color stack is in sRGB color space
115         * already.
116         */
117        public void convertToSrgb() {
118                if (colorspace instanceof sRgb65ColorSpace) {
119                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack is in sRGB already");
120                }
121                
122                final float[] c = new float[3];
123                
124                for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
125                        getPix(i, c);
126                        float[] srgb = colorspace.toRGB(c);
127                        setPix(i, srgb);
128                }
129
130                setColorSpace(sRgb65ColorSpace.getInstance());
131        }
132        
133        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
134        
135        @Override
136        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor() {
137                if (!(colorspace instanceof sRgb65ColorSpace)) {
138                        throw new IllegalStateException("color stack must be in sRGB to convert to ColorProcessor");
139                }
140                return super.toColorProcessor(255);
141        }
142        
143        @Override       // arbitrary scaling is inhibited
144        public ColorProcessor toColorProcessor(double scale) {
145                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
146        }
147        
148        // ------------------------------------------------------------------
149        
150        private float clipTo01(float val) {
151                if (val < 0) return 0f;
152                if (val > 1) return 1f;
153                return val;
154        }
155        
156        private void clipTo01(float[] vals) {
157                for (int i = 0; i < vals.length; i++) {
158                        vals[i] = clipTo01(vals[i]);
159                }
160        }
161    
162}
